zeitfuerzirkus.title: Freeman is Part of TIME FOR CIRCUS 2025
zeitfuerzirkus.description: TIME FOR CIRCUS is the German edition of the internationally held circus festival LA NUIT DU CIRQUE. The 5th edition takes place again in cooperation with the French network Territoires du Cirque.
zeitfuerzirkus.buzzDescription: The Federal Association for Contemporary Circus expands the anniversary edition with the discourse program TIME TO TALK and creates conversations, encounters and exchanges together with seven supra-regional venues.
zeitfuerzirkus.tagline: On equal footing with audience and circus scene

program.title: Program ¬∑ Nov 14‚Äì16, 2025
program.subtitle: Shows, Workshops & Talks ‚Äì all times at a glance.
program.heroSubline: TIME FOR CIRCUS: International circus arts meet freedom, tradition & innovation ‚Äì right in Munich.

manifest.paragraph1: Freeman Festival celebrates the freedom of artistic expression. International circus artists meet in Munich to rethink identity, tradition and innovation ‚Äì bold, poetic, boundary-crossing.
manifest.paragraph2: Rooted in Munich's avant-garde history, a space emerges where diversity becomes strength. A place where differences connect and art becomes a common language.
manifest.paragraph3: In times of division, we invite you to experience freedom anew ‚Äì not as an ego show, but as a collective experience of unity, courage and expression.
manifest.claim: Art is freedom. Circus is freedom. You are free.

events.title: Workshop "Object Manipulation"
events.subtitle: Merri Heikkil√§
events.description: Workshop on using everyday objects as juggling props. Through guided exploration, participants experiment with form, movement and rhythm.
events.detailedDescription: This workshop focuses on using everyday objects as juggling props, offering a different perspective on object manipulation. Through guided exploration, participants experiment with form, movement and rhythm using objects from daily life. The session promotes a thoughtful and creative approach to juggling, emphasizing observation, adaptability and finding new possibilities in familiar things.
events.teacher: Merri Heikkil√§ is a juggler and circus artist who works primarily with contemporary circus. He graduated from Codarts' circus line in Rotterdam in 2017 with a Bachelor's degree in Circus Arts and was involved in founding two new circus groups: Sirkum Polaris and The Nordic Council. He also works in various works and events of the circus group Nuua.
events.idealFor: Contemporary circus artists, jugglers and movement practitioners interested in object manipulation, creative exploration and interdisciplinary experiments.

events.title: TIME TO TALK: BUZZ
events.subtitle: network meeting
events.description: TIME TO TALK is the discourse program of TIME FOR CIRCUS. The Federal Association for Contemporary Circus creates conversations, encounters and exchanges together with seven supra-regional venues. On equal footing with the audience and circus scene, pressing topics of the art form and its actors are discussed in the context of our time.

events.title: Workshop "Stillness in Motion"
events.subtitle: Alise Madara Bokaldere
events.description: "Stillness in Motion" explores the powerful use of stillness ‚Äì not only as a foundation for movement, but also as a technique for improving stage presence.
events.detailedDescription: "Stillness in Motion" explores the powerful use of stillness ‚Äì not only as a foundation for movement, but also as a technique for improving stage presence. We will move within and outside our respective disciplines, enabling you to discover fundamental principles and later integrate them into your own artistic practice. In many art forms, stillness plays a crucial role ‚Äì music is enhanced by pauses, words need spaces to be understandable, and movement works similarly. Forgetting to stop takes away our ability to focus on movement.
events.teacher: Alise Madara Bokaldere is a Latvian dancer/choreographer. She works very closely with details and nuanced movement in her creations, focusing on stage presence, movement quality and concept. She graduated from the Latvian Academy of Culture with a BA in contemporary dance in 2018. She was named best contemporary dancer at the 2024 Latvian Dance Awards.
events.idealFor: This workshop is aimed at dancers and circus artists, including acrobats, aerial artists and jugglers who want to explore new dimensions of expressiveness through the disciplined use of stillness and presence. Also suitable for choreographers and directors who want to deepen their tools and explore concepts of stillness.
events.whatToBring: Participants should wear clothing that allows unrestricted movement, bring water for hydration, and have notebooks and pens for important insights and inspirations during discussions.

events.title: Show "How a Spiral Works"

events.description: Meditative, hypnotic circus: dance, hair hanging & aerial rope, minimalist aesthetics, newly interpreted Baltic folk music.

venue.title: Pepe Dome
venue.subtitle: A place Munich has never seen before
venue.description: Since August 1st, 2025, it stands in Ostpark: the Pepe Dome. A geodesic dome surrounded by greenery, creating space for artistry, dance, and culture ‚Äì modern, open, and inspiring. Its height and architecture enable spectacular aerial acrobatics, while the intimate atmosphere makes every encounter feel personal.
venue.uniqueness: Because the Dome stands for only a limited time, every visit has something unique about it.
venue.experienceSubtitle: The Dome offers more than just shows

about.title: Freeman | Time for Artistry
about.subtitle: Celebrating Freedom of Artistic Expression, Rooted in Connection and Unity
about.tagline: Art is freedom. Artistry is freedom. You are free.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Freeman celebrates artistic freedom by bringing together international artists to explore identity, tradition, and innovation through bold, boundary-pushing performance. In a time of rising division, we come together in movement and expression to reclaim freedom‚Äînot just as individuals, but as a collective act of unity.

munich.title: Why Munich?
paragraphs: Munich's history is steeped in artistic rebellion and innovation. From the expressive ruptures of the Blauer Reiter group to the boundary-breaking performances of the Dada movement, the city has long been a ground zero for movements that redefine culture and confront the status quo.

In hosting Freeman here, we honor this radical past‚Äîwhile rooting our vision in the present, where artistic freedom is more necessary than ever in the face of global tensions, censorship, and polarization.

circus.title: Contemporary Artistry as Language
circus.description: Contemporary artistry, with its rejection of definition and tradition, becomes a perfect meeting ground. It offers a radically open space where cultures, techniques, and bodies can speak together. Here, artistry is not bound by genre or geography. It is a place where a rope, a gesture, or a fall can carry the weight of a homeland or the dream of a borderless world.

questions.title: It asks:
items: How do we stay grounded while reaching across cultures?
How can we use our bodies to tell stories that are both personal and political?
What does it mean to reclaim tradition while inventing new languages?

vision.title: Our Chorus of Freedom
vision.description: This festival is not just about celebrating the individual voice‚Äîit's about creating a chorus. A space where freedom becomes collective, where difference is a source of strength, and where unity is not uniformity, but a shared commitment to truth, vulnerability, and artistic courage.

freedom.closing: In Munich, in this moment, we come together‚Äîacross borders and disciplines.

cta.title: Become Part of the Movement
cta.subtitle: Experience artistic freedom in its purest form
